subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ahhh the infamous Fish!
author: Lisby
full_text:
I don't think Erland was the one bothered with them. Bill  
something...I can't remember his last name. And Charlie with the  
ghost coffee pot. She got them, too.

I heard a lot of what Bill got when he used to post it back on the AA- 
EVP board. I remember none of it rising above the level of swearing  
and threats that we get on occasion. The impression I got at the time  
was that this was a group of deceased humans who had formed a little  
after-death-prankster club. Yes, they could be quite shitty. If I  
recall correctly, they called themselves the Fish Group because they  
said they felt like fish looking out at us through aquarium glass. I  
thought that was a really interesting comment on the separation  
between our planes of reality.

Ann

On Aug 17, 2008, at 4:19 PM, Pridegrl Neverumind wrote:

>
> oh, ok
> thanks
> Charm
>
> --- On Sun, 8/17/08, black bear hollow  
> <blackbearhollow@...>wrote:
> From: black bear hollow <blackbearhollow@...>
> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ahhh the infamous Fish!
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Received: Sunday, August 17, 2008, 3:52 PM
>
> No, I'll post it here. It's the "Fish Group". They aren't people.
>
> They have reeked havoc with a few researchers I know of.
> Everything from serious poltergeist activity to getting in your  
> head where you can hear them 24/7 - telepathically interfering with  
> your thoughts, and they think it's a riot. If I remember correctly,  
> I think the late great Erland had a run in with them. They have  
> been known to harass and be fairly nasty. I've never heard anything  
> "funny" about them. They come through all things electrical and  
> love radios. Which is probably why Frank gets them every so often.
>
> They're the types to tell people to kill their family members and  
> all sorts of weird crap. They get a huge kick out of scaring  
> researchers, that's for sure.
>
> w.
> On Aug 17, 2008, at 3:01 PM, Pridegrl Neverumind wrote:
>
>>
>> can you elbaorate a bit?
>> perhaps youd like to email me directly so as not to annoy others  
>> who dont want to know about fish ppl?
>> Charm

>> They're awful. I had a run in a few years ago. They are more than  
>> pranksters. Damn awful. Clever too.
>>
>> w.
>> On Aug 17, 2008, at 2:56 PM, Lisby wrote:
>>
>>> You're not going to find any, I fear. This seems to be an entity  
>>> collective who enjoy teasing EVP researchers. They caused a lot  
>>> of annoyance to other researchers in the past, but nothing  
>>> serious. Some seemed to be afraid of them, but I never really  
>>> heard of them doing anymore than being annoying and prankish and  
>>> sometimes, well, actually pretty damned funny on occasion.
>>>
>>> Ann
>>
